summary:
Uruk, now called Warka, was an ancient city in Iraq, near the Euphrates River. It was a big and important city in the Sumerian civilization around 3100 BC, with many people living there. The city was famous for its size and influence during this time.

Explorers discovered Uruk in the 1800s, and it was one of the first places to show evidence of early urban life. The city was mentioned in ancient stories, like the legend of King Gilgamesh. Over time, Uruk's importance decreased, but it was still inhabited for many centuries.
title: Uruk
